intro: Agapetes parishii var. parishii, commonly known as the dwarf silver fir, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, cone-like fruits. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are leathery and have a silvery underside, contributing to its common name. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
